text: welcome to daily video vocabulary a dose
of daily new English phrases and words
brought to you by let's talk podcast
calm
Pirlo English learners welcome to daily
video vocabulary episode 41 in today's
episode I have a new word for you
profusely let's find out what it means
and how you can use this word in your
daily conversation profusely
what does profusely mean sometimes you
thank someone over and over for doing
you a favor or helping you in some way
when you needed it the most to show a
great amount of appreciation you
continuously thank them for their
kindness profusely basically means to do
something in excess or overdoing
something it describes something done in
a huge amount or largely when you lose
someone to death you mourn the loss by
crying a lot or in abundance this means
you are crying in a profuse manner or
you are crying profusely as the word
profusely describes the action of doing
something abundantly or largely it is an
adverb all right now that you know what
profusely means let's take a look at
some example sentences to how you can
use it in your daily conversation
example 1 while taking Peter to the
hospital he was bleeding profusely
example two
the old woman thanked us profusely for
giving her a lift in the heavy rains
example three after playing the extra
time in the final match the football
players were sweating profusely example
four besides feeling weak
Jennifer was shivering profusely despite
the medication example 5 as Sara
requested profusely I had to join her
for lunch with her father example 6
Harry apologized profusely to his
annoyed girlfriend for not returning her
call example 7 this book is simply great
it is profusely Illustrated with
sufficient images example 8 mary is
allergic to flowers after smelling them
she starts sneezing profusely
example nine Lisa caught everyone's
attention of the party as she drank in a
profuse manner
example 10 after thinking profusely Mary
decided to take up the new job as it
seemed very exciting
